disease_desc: Abnormal cell growth with the potential to invade or spread to other parts of the body.
food_good_to_have: Broccoli, garlic, berries, green tea, turmeric
food_to_avoid: Processed meats, alcohol, sugary drinks, red meat

disease_desc: A range of conditions that affect the heart, including coronary artery disease, heart failure, and arrhythmias.
food_good_to_have: Fatty fish, whole grains, nuts, seeds, olive oil
food_to_avoid: Saturated and trans fats, sodium, sugary foods

disease_desc: A chronic condition that affects the way the body metabolizes sugar (glucose).
food_good_to_have: Non-starchy vegetables, lean protein, whole grains, legumes
food_to_avoid: Sugary drinks, refined carbohydrates, processed foods

disease_desc: A progressive disease that destroys memory and other important mental functions.
food_good_to_have: Berries, fatty fish, leafy greens, nuts, whole grains
food_to_avoid: Saturated and trans fats, sugary foods, processed foods

disease_desc: Inflammation of the joints, causing pain and stiffness.
food_good_to_have: Fatty fish, ginger, turmeric, leafy greens, olive oil
food_to_avoid: Processed foods, red meat, sugary drinks

disease_desc: A condition in which your airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus.
food_good_to_have: Fruits and vegetables, omega-3 fatty acids, ginger

disease_desc: A condition that weakens bones, making them fragile and more likely to break.
food_good_to_have: Dairy products, leafy greens, fatty fish, fortified foods

disease_desc: A condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.
food_good_to_have: Fruits and vegetables, whole grains, lean protein, low-fat dairy
food_to_avoid: Sodium, saturated and trans fats, alcohol

disease_desc: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
food_good_to_have: Vitamin C rich foods (citrus fruits), zinc rich foods, garlic, honey

disease_desc: A viral infection of your nose and throat (upper respiratory tract).
food_good_to_have: Vitamin C rich foods, ginger, honey

disease_desc: A type of headache that can cause severe throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation, usually on one side of the head.
food_good_to_have: Magnesium rich foods (leafy greens, nuts), ginger
food_to_avoid: Alcohol, caffeine, processed foods, aged cheese

disease_desc: A disorder of the central nervous system (neurological disorder) in which brain activity becomes abnormal, causing seizures or periods of unusual behavior, sensations, and loss of awareness.
A progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement.
A potentially disabling disease of the brain and spinal cord (central nervous system).
A group of disorders that affect a person's ability to move and maintain balance and posture.
A group of diseases that cause progressive weakness and loss of muscle mass.
Occurs when the blood supply to part of your brain is interrupted or reduced, preventing brain tissue from getting oxygen and nutrients.
food_good_to_have: Fruits and vegetables, whole grains, lean protein

disease_desc: Damage to your kidneys and reduces their ability to function normally.
food_good_to_have: Low-sodium foods, low-phosphorus foods, low-potassium foods

disease_desc: Scarring of the liver caused by long-term liver damage.
Inflammation of the pancreas.
Digestive disorder that occurs when stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus.
food_to_avoid: Fatty foods, spicy foods, caffeine, alcohol

disease_desc: A common disorder that affects the large intestine.
A type of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that causes inflammation of your digestive tract.
food_to_avoid: High-fiber foods, fatty foods, spicy foods

disease_desc: An inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that causes inflammation and ulcers in your digestive tract.
food_to_avoid: High-fiber foods, fatty foods, spicy foods

disease_desc: An immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.
A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone.
food_good_to_have: Iodine rich foods, selenium rich foods

disease_desc: Occurs when your thyroid gland produces too much of the hormone thyroxine.
A condition in which you lack enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues.
food_good_to_have: Iron rich foods, vitamin B12 rich foods, folate rich foods
food_to_avoid: Foods that inhibit iron absorption (e.g., tannins in tea)

disease_desc: A type of arthritis that occurs when flexible tissue at the ends of bones wears down.
An autoimmune disease that causes chronic inflammation of the joints.
A type of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe attacks of pain, redness and tenderness in a joint.
A skin disease that causes red, itchy, scaly patches.
A condition that makes your skin red and itchy.
A skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.
A condition that causes redness and visible blood vessels in your face.
A mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest.
A group of mental disorders characterized by significant feelings of anxiety and fear.
A mental disorder that causes unusual shifts in mood, energy, activity levels, concentration, and the ability to carry out day-to-day tasks.
A chronic brain disorder that affects a person's ability to think, feel, and behave clearly.
Persistent problems falling and staying asleep.
food_good_to_have: Tryptophan rich foods (e.g., turkey), magnesium rich foods

disease_desc: A chronic inflammatory lung disease that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs.
Inflammation of the lining of your bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from your lungs.
food_good_to_have: Vitamin C rich foods, anti-inflammatory foods

disease_desc: Infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs.
food_good_to_have: Protein rich foods, vitamin C rich foods

disease_desc: An infectious disease that usually affects the lungs.
food_good_to_have: Protein rich foods, vitamin B rich foods

disease_desc: An inherited disorder that damages the lungs, digestive system and other organs.
food_good_to_have: High-calorie foods, high-fat foods, enzyme supplements

disease_desc: A sleep disorder in which breathing repeatedly stops and starts.
A neurological disorder that affects the control of sleep and wakefulness.
A condition that causes an uncontrollable urge to move your legs, usually because of an uncomfortable sensation.
food_good_to_have: Iron rich foods, magnesium rich foods

disease_desc: An eye condition that damages your optic nerve.
An eye disease that causes vision loss in the center of your visual field.
food_good_to_have: Antioxidant rich foods, omega-3 fatty acids

disease_desc: Clouding of the natural lens of the eye.
food_good_to_have: Antioxidant rich foods, vitamin C, vitamin E
